alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Jo Daviess (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 31 at 5:44PM CDT until March 31 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Jo Daviess County in northwestern Illinois... Carroll County in northwestern Illinois... Jackson County in east central Iowa... Central Dubuque County in northeastern Iowa... Northern Clinton County in east central Iowa... * Until 645 PM CDT. * At 543 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Elkport to Big Rock, moving northeast at 55 mph. THESE ARE DESTRUCTIVE STORMS FOR the Highway 20 corridor. HAZARD...80 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be heavily damaged. Expect considerable damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles. Extensive tree damage and power outages are likely. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Grand Mound around 550 PM CDT. DeWitt and Welton around 600 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Charlotte, Goose Lake, Miles, Bryant, Clinton, Andover, Bulgers Hollow, Camp Miss-Elk-Ton, Teeds Grove, Sabula, Thomson, Thomson Causeway, South Sabula Lake Park, Argo Fay, Wacker, Ideal and Center Hill. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...80 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for northwestern Illinois...and northeastern and east central Iowa. This is an EXTREMELY DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms are producing widespread wind damage across Deleware County. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows! A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for northwestern Illinois...and northeastern and east central Iowa.
